benchmark_details.name: Image Fusion via Vision-Language Model (FILM)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents the FILM paradigm for image fusion, which utilizes explicit textual information from source images to guide the fusion process, showing promising results in multiple image fusion tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance image fusion techniques by integrating vision-language models to enhance semantic understanding in fusion processes.

data.source: Vision-Language Fusion (VLF) dataset containing annotated prompts and descriptions for various image fusion datasets.
data.annotation: ChatGPT-generated paragraphs based on image pairs from established datasets.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the comparison of fused and source images.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better quality of the fused image.
methodology.validation: Tested against various state-of-the-art image fusion methods.
